title: Instructional Design Strategies for Addressing Heterogeneity in History Education

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding core concepts of historical learning and foundational knowledge of scientific inquiry methods
context.additional_context: Need for Customized History Education Design Considering Learners' Diverse Background Knowledge and Varied Access to Technology

learning_goals: Learners can achieve over 80% understanding of heterogeneous groups through collaborative learning activities analyzing historical events from multiple perspectives.
Learners can improve their ability to apply historical concepts by over 75% while performing tasks with hierarchical approaches.
Learners can enhance their ability to interpret complex historical materials by over 70% according to scaffolding strategies.

resources: Digital resources related to history topics
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
